title: The Great Impressionists
creator_credit: Steve Isaac, Australian National Gallery and Capital 7 Canberra
brief_description: The Great Impressionists exhibition at the Australian National Gallery in 1984 featured works of leading Impressionists such as Manet, Degas, Renoir, Monet, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Pissaro, Gauguin and Seurat. The script, explaining the priceless collection on loan from the Courtauld Institute in London, was written by the Gallery’s Senior Curator of Education, Terence Measham with the express desire to delight and entertain as well as inform.
